hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Transition on 3-Day Momentum Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) and BTC experiences a 3-day momentum breakout above its 20-day Bollinger Band upper band while volume expands by >40% vs 10-day average, a transition to BULL regime occurs within 5 trading days with 70% probability, generating mean returns of +8% over the subsequent 10 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often precede directional breaks. Volume-confirmed breakouts above volatility bands during neutral periods signal institutional accumulation and momentum ignition. High ETH/BTC correlation confirms broad market participation rather than isolated BTC move.
entry_conditions: BTC price closes above 20-day Bollinger Band upper band (2 std)
Daily volume > 40% above 10-day moving average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: 10% gain from entry OR regime transitions to BULL (confirmed by FjordHQ regime detector)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 4% loss from entry OR BTC closes below 20-day SMA

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If breakout occurs but regime remains NEUTRAL or transitions to BEAR > 50% of instances within test window, OR if mean 10-day returns post-breakout are ≤ 2%.
